title: I05-5004

sentences.text: Towards deep analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases , we have examined a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples , in which sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement .
Our preliminary experiments on building a paraphrase corpus have so far been producing promising results , which we have evaluated according to cost-efficiency , exhaustiveness , and reliability .

Entity-compositional_class_of_paraphrase.label: compositional classes of paraphrases
Entity-compositional_class_of_paraphrase.description: Compositional classes of paraphrases refer to distinct categories of paraphrases that are analyzed and collected systematically, allowing for the organization and evaluation of paraphrase examples based on their structural and semantic similarities.

Entity-class-oriented_framework.label: class-oriented framework
Entity-class-oriented_framework.description: The class-oriented framework refers to a systematic approach for collecting and analyzing paraphrase examples by categorizing them into distinct classes, utilizing both automatic generation of candidates and manual evaluation to ensure quality.

Entity-our_preliminary_experiment.label: Our preliminary experiments
Entity-our_preliminary_experiment.description: Our preliminary experiments refer to the initial investigations conducted to build a paraphrase corpus, which have yielded promising results evaluated based on cost-efficiency, exhaustiveness, and reliability.

Entity-paraphrase_corpus.label: paraphrase corpus
Entity-paraphrase_corpus.description: A paraphrase corpus is a collection of text pairs that express the same meaning in different wording, used for training and evaluating natural language processing models, particularly in tasks related to paraphrasing and semantic similarity.

Entity-promising_result.label: promising results
Entity-promising_result.description: The term 'promising results' refers to the positive outcomes observed from preliminary experiments conducted in the development of a paraphrase corpus, evaluated based on criteria such as cost-efficiency, exhaustiveness, and reliability.

Entity-sentential_paraphrase.label: sentential paraphrases
Entity-sentential_paraphrase.description: Sentential paraphrases are linguistic constructs that express the same meaning as a given sentence but use different wording or structure.

Entity-automatic_candidate_generation.label: automatic candidate generation
Entity-automatic_candidate_generation.description: Automatic candidate generation refers to a computational process or algorithm used to systematically produce potential examples or instances, often for tasks such as paraphrase collection or other forms of data generation in natural language processing.

Entity-paraphrase_example.label: paraphrase examples
Entity-paraphrase_example.description: Paraphrase examples are instances of sentences that convey the same meaning using different wording, often used to illustrate variations in expression within a specific paraphrase class.

Entity-reliability.label: reliability
Entity-reliability.description: In the context of evaluating the effectiveness of a paraphrase corpus, 'reliability' refers to the consistency and dependability of the results obtained from the experiments conducted, serving as a quality factor and evaluation metric for the framework used.

Entity-exhaustiveness.label: exhaustiveness
Entity-exhaustiveness.description: Exhaustiveness refers to a quality factor or evaluation metric that measures the completeness and thoroughness of the paraphrase corpus collected in the study.

Entity-manual_judgement.label: manual judgement
Entity-manual_judgement.description: Manual judgement refers to the process of evaluating or assessing something based on human decision-making and subjective criteria, rather than relying solely on automated or algorithmic methods.

Entity-preliminary_experiment.label: preliminary experiments
Entity-preliminary_experiment.description: Preliminary experiments refer to initial research activities conducted to test hypotheses or gather data before more extensive studies are undertaken.

Entity-result.label: results
Entity-result.description: Results refer to the outcomes or findings obtained from experiments or research activities.

Entity-cost-efficiency.label: cost-efficiency
Entity-cost-efficiency.description: Cost-efficiency refers to the effectiveness of a process or system in achieving desired outcomes relative to the costs incurred, often used as a metric to evaluate economic performance.

summary: Towards deep analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases , we have examined a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples , in which sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement . Our preliminary experiments on building a paraphrase corpus have so far been producing promising results , which we have evaluated according to cost-efficiency , exhaustiveness , and reliability .

Predicate-are_collected_by_means_of.label: are collected by means of
Predicate-are_collected_by_means_of.description: The predicate 'are collected by means of' indicates a process or method through which the subject is gathered or obtained, utilizing the specified object as the tool, technique, or approach that facilitates this collection.

Predicate-producing.label: producing
Predicate-producing.description: The predicate 'producing' indicates an active process whereby the subject generates, creates, or yields the object. It establishes a relationship in which the subject is the source or initiator of the action, and the object represents the outcome or result of that action. This connection implies a transformation or development from the subject's efforts to the tangible or observable results denoted by the object.

Predicate-evaluated_according_to.label: evaluated according to
Predicate-evaluated_according_to.description: The predicate 'evaluated according to' establishes a relationship where the subject is assessed or judged based on the criteria or standard specified by the object. It indicates that the evaluation process involves measuring or analyzing the subject in relation to the characteristics or metrics defined by the object.

Predicate-have_been_producing.label: have been producing
Predicate-have_been_producing.description: The predicate 'have been producing' indicates a continuous or ongoing action performed by the subject that results in the creation or generation of the object. It suggests that the subject has been actively engaged in a process over a period of time, leading to the emergence of the object, which is typically a tangible outcome or result. This construction emphasizes the duration and persistence of the action, highlighting the relationship between the subject's efforts and the resultant object.

Predicate-have_evaluated.label: have evaluated
Predicate-have_evaluated.description: The predicate 'have evaluated' indicates that the subject has conducted an assessment or analysis regarding the object. It implies a process of examination or judgment that leads to a conclusion about the characteristics, performance, or value of the object in question.

Predicate-have_been_building.label: have been building
Predicate-have_been_building.description: The predicate 'have been building' indicates an ongoing action or process that connects the subject and object, suggesting that the subject has been engaged in the activity of constructing, developing, or creating the object over a period of time. This implies a continuous effort or work that has been taking place, often with the intention of achieving a specific outcome related to the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset of a more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or instances than the subject, thereby providing a context in which the subject can be understood as part of a larger framework.
